channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CO

item.title: Report X-2023070738
item.description:
Report X-2023070738

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-01T03:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-03
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in the load side wet, upon inspection contents were found having a loosed cap and about 1 liter having leaked out. Leak was mainly contained to box, remaining contents absorbed with absorbent pads. Package was loaded into a damage tote lined with plastic bag. DescribePack: Cap was loosened. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed on top of absorbent pads, though most was contained to outer box.

item.title: Report X-2023070693
item.description:
Report X-2023070693

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-01T03:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-02
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking in the unload, it was brought to QA in a salvage drum with liner. Leak was contained to package at first, orientation arrows were not followed, so all contents of one container were allowed to leak out. DescribePack: One lid of two were found detached from bottle, it is unclear how this happened, as cap is not threaded, nor were there any signs of dents or compression on the bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was brought to QA in a damage tote with liner. Once brought to QA, the undamaged bottle was placed upright.

Report X-2023070617

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: This hazmat was discovered leaking by operations manager whom put the hazmat in a red tote, and placed it in fumigator inside hazmat cage. DescribePack: The glass bottle is leaking clear and smelly liquid from the cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat was placed in a plastic bag and red tote.

item.title: Report X-2023070119
item.description:
Report X-2023070119

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-28T15:11:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-26
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg. was in QA hazmat cage when arrived and I did research and it looked like this went through the sorter when it should of not have so I sent a email to all the Ops Manager to please have in presort meeting NO HAZMATS in sorter DescribePack: Closure came loose and liquid leaked out soiling outer carton DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. was placed in hazmat cage inside a lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2023061720
item.description:
Report X-2023061720

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-27T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-25
  • City: COLORADO SPRINGS
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS LOADED ON THE FLOOR. A NEAR BY PACKAGE FELL ON TOP AND CAUSE THE WALLS OF THE BOX TO BURST AND THE NECK OF THE CONTAINERS CRUSHED DescribePack: THE LID BECAME LOOSE AND THE SPILL WENT INTO THE FIBERBOARD CONTAINER. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS ISOLATED AND THE AREA WAS WELL VENTED.

  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one of the 50 pound poly bags of phycomycin (un3378) releasing 4 pounds of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

DescribePack: top of inner can was dented and punctured because pkg. was dropped DurationRel: 15 and MitigateEffect: QA placed inside a lined tote and took to hazmat cage

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pail came to QA on IC belt inside a lined tote wet and when inspected the closure came loose and a small amount of liquid leaked out soiling outer pail and label DescribePack: closure came loose and when inspected popped lid back on DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: QA placed inside hazmat cage to get inspected

item.title: Report X-2023061665
item.description:
Report X-2023061665

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-25T15:12:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-24
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking when being loaded onto the vans during preload. Package was brought to QA or inspection. Upon inspection contents were found with loose caps. DescribePack: Loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a damage tote with plastic liner and orientation arrows being followed.
